verses.kjv: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
verses.ct: Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded:

verses.kjv: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
verses.ct: "Would a wise person spout empty opinions and stuff himself with hot air?

verses.kjv: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
verses.ct: Would he argue with useless words, or make speeches that accomplish nothing?

verses.kjv: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
verses.ct: You are actually undermining reverence for God and discouraging prayer in his presence.

verses.kjv: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
verses.ct: Your own sin drives what you say, and you've adopted the language of the cunning.

verses.kjv: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
verses.ct: Your own mouth convicts you, not me — your own lips serve as evidence against you.

verses.kjv: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?
verses.ct: Were you the first human ever born? Were you brought into existence before the mountains?

verses.kjv: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
verses.ct: Have you listened in on God's private counsel? Do you have some monopoly on wisdom?

verses.kjv: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?
verses.ct: What do you know that we don't? What do you understand that is beyond us?

verses.kjv: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
verses.ct: Among us are gray-haired elders, men far older than your own father.

verses.kjv: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
verses.ct: Are God's comforts not enough for you? Is there some hidden issue we're missing?

verses.kjv: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,
verses.ct: Why does your passion run away with you? Why do your eyes flash with such emotion,

verses.kjv: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?
verses.ct: that you direct your anger against God and let such words pour from your mouth?

verses.kjv: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
verses.ct: What is a human being that he could be pure? How can anyone born of a woman be righteous?

verses.kjv: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.
verses.ct: Look — God doesn't even place full trust in his holy ones, and the heavens themselves aren't pure in his sight.

verses.kjv: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?
verses.ct: How much less a person who is disgusting and corrupt, who drinks up sin like water!

verses.kjv: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
verses.ct: Listen to me, and I'll explain. Let me tell you what I've observed —

verses.kjv: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:
verses.ct: truths that wise people have passed down from their ancestors without holding anything back,

verses.kjv: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
verses.ct: people to whom alone the land was given, when no foreigner had yet come among them.

verses.kjv: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
verses.ct: The wicked person writhes in agony throughout his life, and the years reserved for the tyrant are few.

verses.kjv: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
verses.ct: Terrifying sounds fill his ears; even in times of peace, a destroyer attacks him.

verses.kjv: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
verses.ct: He has no hope of escaping the darkness; a sword is waiting for him.

verses.kjv: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
verses.ct: He wanders around searching for food, asking, 'Where can I find it?' He knows that a day of darkness is closing in on him.

verses.kjv: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
verses.ct: Distress and anguish overwhelm him; they overpower him like a king charging into battle.

verses.kjv: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
verses.ct: This is because he raised his fist against God and defied the Almighty,

verses.kjv: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:
verses.ct: charging at him stubbornly, rushing headlong behind the thick layers of his shield.

verses.kjv: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.
verses.ct: Though his face grew plump with fat and his waist was thick with excess,

verses.kjv: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.
verses.ct: he will end up living in ruined cities, in abandoned houses destined to crumble into rubble.

verses.kjv: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
verses.ct: He won't stay wealthy; his possessions won't last, and his prosperity won't spread across the land.

verses.kjv: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.
verses.ct: He won't escape the darkness; fire will scorch his branches, and God's breath will sweep him away.

verses.kjv: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.
verses.ct: He shouldn't fool himself by trusting in worthless things, because worthlessness is all he'll get in return.

verses.kjv: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
verses.ct: His end will come before his time, and his branches will never flourish again.

verses.kjv: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
verses.ct: He'll be like a vine that drops its unripe grapes, like an olive tree that sheds its blossoms.

verses.kjv: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.
verses.ct: The community of the godless will be left barren, and fire will consume the homes built on bribes.

verses.kjv: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
verses.ct: They plot trouble, produce what is worthless, and their minds are always brewing deception."
